Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery cup, probably a band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: part of incised handle zone palmette with added red on heart and two fronds; at right, imitation letters in black; black zone below.
Curator's comments: According to Venit, this is a little master cup of an uncertain type.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 418, no. B651)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0555) (Phase 1)
